--- execute: echo: false message: false warning: false --- # Spotify Data One of my favorite hobbies is listening to music. Not just through headphones or in the car, but listening to live music and experiencing all of the energy that comes with live performances. Some time ago I found out that R had a package, `spotifyr` @spotify_r, that was a wrapper for getting track audio features from Spotify's API. I started exploring the functionality of the package along with a few projects people had done (see ) https://d2l.ai/index.html ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ## Exploratory Data Analysis ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Distribution of Song Counts by Genre
Genre Count
country 4943
edm 5629
latin 4637
metal 5418
pop 5666
r&b 5092
rap 5440
rock 4929
````` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](spotify_data_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Data Cleaning ::: {.cell} :::
